bills.title: Charlie Kirk Freedom of Speech Plaza Act
bills.description: Would redesignate Black Lives Matter Plaza (16th Street NW between H Street and K Street) as 'Charlie Kirk Freedom of Speech Plaza' and require installation of street signage

bills.title: DC Government Employment and Contracting Restrictions
bills.description: Would prohibit the District of Columbia government from appointing individuals convicted of crimes of violence or dangerous crimes as employees of the government or from entering into contracts with vendors who employ such individuals. Overrides DC's local hiring and contracting policies, including 'ban the box' initiatives designed to provide employment opportunities for formerly incarcerated residents.

bills.title: BOWSER Act
bills.description: Would repeal the Home Rule Act

bills.title: Washington, D.C. Residents Voting Act
bills.description: Would retrocede D.C. to Maryland

bills.title: Matthew Lawrence Perna Act of 2025
bills.description: Would, among other things, allow an individual charged with committing a crime in D.C. to move the trial to the individual's home state

bills.title: Protecting Our Nation's Capital Emergency Act of 2025
bills.description: Would repeal police discipline provisions of the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Amendment Act of 2022

bills.title: District of Columbia Federal Immigration Compliance Act
bills.description: Would require D.C. to cooperate with federal immigration agencies

bills.title: DC CRIMES Act of 2025
bills.description: Would prohibit the D.C. Council from changing criminal penalties, amend the Youth Rehabilitation Amendment Act of 2018 and require D.C. to publicly post information about juvenile crime

bills.title: Crime Emergency Extension Resolution
bills.description: To extend the emergency determined by the President on August 11, 2025, in the Executive Order titled "Declaring a crime emergency in the District of Columbia"

bills.title: Presidential Emergency Extension Amendment
bills.description: Would amend Section 740 of the Home Rule Act to permit the president to declare an emergency for 180 days, and the amendment would be retroactive to an emergency declared before enactment

bills.title: Keep Offenders Off Our Streets Act
bills.description: Would prohibit the Council from enacting, and the mayor from enforcing, a law that permits a defendant to be released pretrial without a secured appearance bond, and prohibits the Council from ever enacting such a law

bills.title: Ending Cashless Bail in Our Nation's Capital Act
bills.description: Would require D.C. to allow cash bail, as well as require D.C. to have an automatic presumption of pretrial detention, for certain crimes

bills.title: Juvenile Charging Age Reduction
bills.description: Would lower the age at which a minor may be charged as an adult

bills.title: District of Columbia Policing Protection Act
bills.description: Would weaken limitations on vehicular pursuits by police officers

bills.title: CLEAN DC Act
bills.fullTitle: Common-Sense Law Enforcement and Accountability Now in D.C. Act
bills.description: Would repeal the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Amendment Act of 2022

bills.title: Capital Emergency Control Act of 2025
bills.description: Would amend section 740 of the Home Rule Act to allow the president to extend emergency control of the D.C. police department for additional 30-day periods indefinitely

bills.title: District of Columbia Cash Bail Reform Act
bills.fullTitle: District of Columbia Cash Bail Reform Act of 2025
bills.description: Would require pretrial detention and a secured appearance bond for certain crimes

bills.title: Strong Sentences for Safer D.C. Streets Act
bills.description: Would increase existing and establish new mandatory minimums

bills.title: Second Chance and Incarceration Reduction Repeal
bills.description: Would repeal the Second Chance Amendment Act of 2022 and the Incarceration Reduction Amendment Act of 2016

bills.title: Clean and Managed Public Spaces Act
bills.description: Would impose criminal penalties for camping on public property

bills.title: Public Property Camping Penalties
bills.description: Would impose criminal penalties for camping on public property

bills.title: JUSTICE in D.C. Act
bills.description: Would repeal the Second Look Amendment Act of 2022 and the Incarceration Reduction Amendment Act of 2016 and provide funding for victim services

bills.title: District of Columbia Judicial Nominations Reform Act
bills.description: Would abolish the Judicial Nomination Commission

bills.title: District of Columbia Attorney General Appointment Reform Act
bills.description: Would grant the president authority to appoint the Attorney General

bills.title: Noncitizen Voting Prohibition
bills.description: Would prohibit noncitizens from voting in D.C. and repeal the Local Resident Voting Rights Amendment Act of 2022

bills.title: District of Columbia One Vote One Choice Act
bills.description: Would prohibit ranked choice voting

bills.title: Noncitizen Voting Budget Amendment
bills.description: Amendment to fiscal year 2025 budget resolution that would establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to prohibiting or limiting noncitizen voting

bills.title: Proving Residency for Overseas Voter Eligibility Act
bills.description: Would deem as D.C. residents for purposes of federal elections in D.C. nonmilitary overseas voters who can't prove residency in the state in which they are seeking to vote in a federal election

bills.title: No Taxpayer Funding for Abortion and Abortion Insurance Full Disclosure Act of 2025
bills.description: Would, among other things, permanently prohibit D.C. funds approved by Congress from being used for abortion, prohibit D.C. employees from providing an abortion and prohibit abortion in D.C. facilities

bills.title: Full-Year Continuing Appropriations 2025 - Abortion
bills.description: Prohibited use of funds on abortion

bills.title: Insurance Regulation Disapproval Resolution
bills.description: Disapproval resolution on the Insurance Regulation Amendment Act of 2024 (reproductive health care and gender-affirming care)

bills.title: Chloe Cole Act
bills.description: Would, among other things, prohibit gender affirming care for children within D.C.

bills.title: Protecting Women's Private Spaces Act
bills.description: Would prohibit an individual from accessing or using a single-sex facility on government property other than those corresponding to the biological sex of such individual

bills.title: Full-Year Continuing Appropriations 2025 - Marijuana
bills.description: Prohibited using of funds on commercializing recreational marijuana

bills.title: Open Meetings Clarification Repeal
bills.description: Would repeal the Open Meetings Clarification Emergency Amendment Act of 2025

bills.title: Open Meetings Clarification Disapproval Resolution
bills.description: Disapproval resolution on the Open Meetings Clarification Temporary Amendment Act of 2025

bills.title: Oswaldo Paya Way Designation
bills.description: Would designate the area between the intersections of 16th Street, Northwest and Fuller Street, Northwest and 16th Street, Northwest and Euclid Street, Northwest as "Oswaldo Paya Way"

bills.title: Alexi Navalny Way Designation
bills.description: Would designate the area of Sumner Row between 16th Street Northwest and L Street Northwest as "Alexi Navalny Way"

bills.title: Black Lives Matter Plaza Removal
bills.description: Would withhold 50 percent of federal highway funds unless the mayor removes the phrase Black Lives Matter from the street symbolically designated as Black Lives Matter Plaza, redesignates such street as Liberty Plaza, and removes such phrase from each website, document, and other material

bills.title: Jimmy Lai Way Designation
bills.description: Would designate the area between 18th Street Northwest and Church Street Northwest as "Jimmy Lai Way" to honor the imprisoned Hong Kong democracy activist. Also being advanced as Amendment 86 to H.R. 5491, scheduled for House Foreign Affairs Committee markup. While honoring Jimmy Lai's fight for democracy is laudable, this bill bypasses DC's local street naming process. Congress should work with DC Council to support this designation rather than imposing it unilaterallyâ€”the same democratic principles Jimmy Lai fights for should apply to DC residents.

bills.title: Traffic Camera Repeal Amendment
bills.description: Amendment that would repeal the automated traffic enforcement law

bills.title: Right Turn Prohibition Repeal Amendment
bills.description: Amendment that would repeal the law that prohibits right turns on red

bills.title: Stop DC CAMERA Act
bills.fullTitle: Stop DC Capital Authoritarian Motorvehicle Enforcement and Restoration of Autonomy Act
bills.description: Would eliminate all 547 of D.C.'s automated traffic enforcement cameras (speed, red light, stop sign) and repeal laws banning right turns on red. The cameras currently generate over $200M annually in revenue and are used to enforce safety laws under the Vision Zero initiative. DOT is also proposing to ban cameras via upcoming surface transportation bill.

committees: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

bills.title: Charlie Kirk Patriot Way Designation
bills.description: To designate the area of H Street Northwest between Connecticut Avenue Northwest and Vermont Avenue Northwest in Washington, District of Columbia, as "Charlie Kirk Patriot Way"

bills.title: Freedom to Petition the Government Act
bills.description: Would treat meetings nonprofits hold with federal officials in D.C. as activities not constituting doing business in D.C. for purposes of determining whether organizations are required to register with D.C.

bills.title: Families' Rights and Responsibilities Act
bills.description: Would prohibit the government from substantially burdening the fundamental right of parents to direct the upbringing, education and health care of their children without demonstrating that the infringement is required by a compelling governmental interest of the highest order as applied to the parent and the child and is the least restrictive means of furthering that compelling governmental interest

bills.title: Legislative Authority Budget Amendment
bills.description: Amendment to fiscal year 2025 budget resolution that would establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund "relating to Congress reasserting legislative authority over the District of Columbia"

bills.title: Full-Year Continuing Appropriations 2025 - Budget Cut
bills.description: Cut the fiscal year 2025 local budget by more than $1 billion

bills.title: Make American Flags in America Act of 2025
bills.description: Would prohibit the purchase or display of U.S. flags not made in America

bills.title: Agency Interpretation Deference Prohibition
bills.description: Would prohibit requiring tribunals in court or administrative proceedings to defer to the mayor's interpretation of statutes and regulations and repeal the Review of Agency Action Clarification Temporary Amendment Act of 2024

bills.title: Delivering On Government Efficiency in Spending Act
bills.description: Would treat D.C. as a federal agency for purposes of the Treasury disbursement system

bills.title: District of Columbia Sister City Integrity Act
bills.description: Would prohibit entering into or maintaining a sister city relationship with a jurisdiction located in a foreign adversary country

bills.title: Emergency Bill Disapproval Resolution Act
bills.description: Would make emergency bills subject to disapproval resolutions

bills.title: Congressional Concealed Carry in D.C.
bills.description: Would permit members of Congress who are authorized to carry a concealed gun in their state to carry in D.C.

bills.title: District of Columbia Home Rule Improvement Act
bills.description: Would make both civil and criminal bills enacted by D.C. subject to a 60-legislative-day review period, permit a disapproval resolution to disapprove individual provisions of a bill enacted by D.C., prohibit D.C. from enacting a bill that is substantially the same as a bill that has been subject to an enacted disapproval resolution, prohibit D.C. from withdrawing a bill that is undergoing the congressional review period, subject successive emergency bills to a congressional review period and subject executive orders and regulations issued by the mayor and executive branch agencies, respectively, to a congressional review period, and require the mayor and Council chair to testify annually before House and Senate committees

bills.title: No DEI in DC Act
bills.description: Repeals, amends and blocks D.C. from using funds to carry out laws, policies, offices and commissions related to diversity, equity and inclusion

bills.title: D.C. Shield Law Repeal Act
bills.description: Would repeal D.C.'s Human Rights Sanctuary Amendment Act of 2022, removing protections for abortion and gender-affirming care providers from out-of-state investigations and prosecutions

status.lastAction: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

bills.title: Disapproval of D.C. Tax Decoupling from Federal OBBBA Changes
bills.fullTitle: Disapproving the action of the District of Columbia Council in approving the D.C. Income and Franchise Tax Conformity and Revision Temporary Amendment Act of 2025
bills.description: Would overturn the DC Council's November 2025 decision to unlink its tax code from costly federal tax cuts in the One Big Beautiful Bill Act (OBBBA), preventing the loss of $658 million in local revenue over four years. The OBBBA tax cuts overwhelmingly benefit DC households with incomes over $1.3 million. DC chose not to replicate those cuts locally and instead invested in expanding the Earned Income Tax Credit (accelerated to a full 100% local match) and a new $1,000-per-child tax credit for families earning under $75K/$90K â€” reaching 78,000 children and projected to reduce DC child poverty by 20%. Ten other states have taken similar decoupling action. If this disapproval resolution passes, DC loses local revenue, proven anti-poverty tax credits, and risks another credit downgrade.

status.lastAction: Signed into law by President Trump. DC Council Chairman Mendelson maintains the decoupling law already took effect Feb 11 â€” before the Senate voted â€” making the disapproval resolution invalid. No formal legal challenge filed yet.
committees: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

bills.title: District of Columbia Medicaid Fairness Act
bills.description: Would phase down DC's Federal Medical Assistance Percentage (FMAP) from 70% to the standard state formula by FY2030, cutting hundreds of millions in federal Medicaid funding and forcing DC to slash healthcare services or find replacement revenue

status.lastAction: Referred to Committee on Energy and Commerce

bills.title: SOAR Act Improvements Act
bills.fullTitle: Scholarships for Opportunity and Results Act Improvements Act
bills.description: Reauthorizes and expands the federally imposed DC Opportunity Scholarship Program (private school vouchers) through FY2032 at M/year. Expands eligibility to pre-K, allows unaccredited schools to participate, and shifts nonprofit board governance away from DC residents

status.lastAction: Ordered reported by Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

bills.title: No More D.C. Waste Act
bills.description: Would retroactively lapse approximately  million in previously appropriated but unspent DC Tuition Assistance Grant (DCTAG) funds and eliminate DC's ability to roll over unused DCTAG funding. DCTAG exists because DC residents cannot attend an in-state public university

bills.title: Make American Flags in America Act of 2025
bills.description: Requires U.S. flags on federal property to be domestically manufactured. Defines the DC government as a "federal agency," reinforcing the constitutional framework that denies DC self-governance. No state government is classified this way

status.lastAction: Referred to Committee on Judiciary and Committee on Energy and Commerce

bills.title: SOAR Permanent Authorization Act
bills.fullTitle: Scholarships for Opportunity and Results Permanent Authorization Act
bills.description: Would permanently authorize the federally imposed DC Opportunity Scholarship Program at M/year, removing the periodic reauthorization votes that are the only remaining moments of democratic accountability for this program DC residents never asked for

status.lastAction: Referred to Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

bills.title: Constitutional Amendment - Noncitizen Voting Prohibition
bills.description: Proposes a constitutional amendment barring non-citizens from voting in any federal, state, or local election, including in DC. Would permanently override DC's 2022 Local Resident Voting Rights Amendment Act allowing noncitizen residents to vote in local elections

bills.title: CHOICE Act
bills.fullTitle: Creating Hope and Opportunity for Individuals and Communities through Education Act
bills.description: Broad national school choice bill funneling B+ to private schools. Includes provisions expanding the federally imposed DC Opportunity Scholarship Program. DC is consistently used as the testing ground for voucher programs that Congress cannot impose on any state

status.lastAction: Referred to Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

bills.title: Financial Services and General Government Appropriations Act, 2026
bills.description: Senate FY2026 appropriations bill containing two legacy anti-home rule riders: prohibiting DC from using locally raised tax dollars for abortion services, and prohibiting DC from regulating adult-use marijuana despite 71% voter approval in 2014

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Police Reform
riders.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to carry out the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Amendment Act of 2022

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Youth Rehabilitation
riders.description: Would repeal provisions of the Youth Rehabilitation Amendment Act of 2018

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Noncitizen Voting
riders.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to implement the Local Resident Voting Rights Amendment Act of 2022 or any activities related to enrolling or registering noncitizens into voter rolls for local elections

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Vehicle Emissions
riders.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to enforce the rule relating to 'Adoption of California Vehicle Emission Standards'

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Oil & Gas Protection
riders.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to implement or enforce provisions of the Consumer Protection Act against oil and gas companies for environmental claims

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Abortion
riders.description: Would prohibit the use of funds for abortion

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Reproductive Health Non-Discrimination
riders.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to carry out the Reproductive Health Non-Discrimination Amendment Act of 2014

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Death with Dignity
riders.description: Would repeal the Death with Dignity Act of 2016 and purports to prohibit enactment of a similar law

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - COVID Mandates
riders.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to implement, administer or enforce any COVIDâ€“19 mask or vaccine mandate

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Insurance Regulation
riders.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to implement the Insurance Regulation Amendment Act of 2024 (reproductive health care and gender-affirming care)

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Marijuana
riders.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to commercialize recreational marijuana

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Right Turn on Red
riders.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to enact or carry out any law that prohibits motorists from making right turns on red, including the Safer Streets Amendment Act of 2022

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Traffic Cameras
riders.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to carry the automated traffic enforcement law

riders.title: Senate D.C. Appropriations - Cruz Traffic Camera Amendment
riders.description: Senate floor amendment to the D.C. Appropriations bill that would prohibit D.C. from using funds to carry out its automated traffic enforcement law. Senate counterpart to the House rider in H.R. 5166.

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Anti-SLAPP
riders.description: Would repeal Section 5 of the Corrections Oversight Improvement Omnibus Amendment Act of 2022 (exemptions to anti-Strategic Lawsuits Against Public Participation law)

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Concealed Carry
riders.description: Would provide that an individual who has a valid weapons carry permit from any state or territory may possess and carry a concealed handgun, magazine and ammunition in an area governed by D.C. or the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Sister Cities China
riders.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to plan, support, or implement a sister city relationship with a city in China

riders.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Shield Law
riders.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to carry out title I or title II of the Human Rights Sanctuary Amendment Act of 2022 (shield law)

supportBills.title: Words Matter for the District of Columbia Courts Act
supportBills.description: Updates DC court code to replace the outdated term "retarded" with "individuals with intellectual disabilities." Companion House bill H.R. 1022 sponsored by Del. Eleanor Holmes Norton. Illustrates the home rule problem: DC cannot update its own legal terminology without Congressional action
